item.title: Design Patterns Reviewed - Part 2: Structural
item.description: This is the second post in a series in which I’m reviewing software design patterns. This time out I’m taking a look at structural patterns. These are all strategies for defining and managing relationships between classes and interfaces.

item.title: SOLID: the 'SO' stands for Snake Oil
item.description: SOLID is possibly the most over-hyped concept in all of software engineering. You can throw away that jar of Sudocrem because we’ll have no fence-sitting today, no sir.

item.title: Design Patterns Reviewed - Part 1: Creational
item.description: This is the first post in a series in which I’ll be reviewing software design patterns, giving my opinions on which you should use and which you should avoid. I’ve grouped them into the same categories as they are in the Gang of Four’s Design Patterns. The first group I’ll be covering are creational patterns. These are all strategies that you can choose when deciding how to instantiate an object.
